page.title: 08NORTH RONALDSAY'S BIRDS
page.content: North Ronaldsay is a very special place for birds.Because of its situation,migrating birds are seen in large numbers in spring and Autumn moving to and from the Scandinadian countries as well as the island groups of Shetland and Faeroe,and also Iceland and Greenland.Some even come and go to Canada,and rare birds from as far as Siberia arrive every year. The birds concentrate on islands because they connot rest on the sea.The movement of seabirds is also well seen from the top of the island being the boundry between the North Sea and the Atlantic Ocean,and in the right season with suitable weather conditions,tens of thousands of seabirds can be seen moving between the two.
